Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • Container
      • Map

  • class Map
extends Container
    The map class that contains data on the locations of cites and the connections between them

        public void addCity(City city)
        Add a city to the map
        Parameters:

      • getCity

        public City getCity(java.lang.String c)
        Get the city object with the specified name
        Parameters:
        c - the name of the city
        Returns:
        The city object with the given name, null if no city is found

      • addRoute

        public void addRoute(Route route)
        Add a route to the map between two cities
        Parameters:
        route - the route to be added containing the two cities, the colour, the number of segments and the lateral offset

      • getRoute

        public Route getRoute(City a,
                      City b)
        Get the route object that contains the two given city objects
        Parameters:
        a - the first city
        b - the second city
        Returns:
        The route object that connects city a to city b, null if no such route exists on the map

      • getRoute

        public Route getRoute(java.lang.String cityA,
                      java.lang.String cityB)
        Get a new route object that contains the cities corresponding to the city names given
        Parameters:
        cityA - the name of the first city
        cityB - the name of the second city
        Returns:
        A new route object that connects city a to city b, null if either of the cities can't be found on the map

      • addRoute

        public boolean addRoute(java.lang.String cityA,
                        java.lang.String cityB,
                        int length,
                        java.lang.String colour)
        Add a route to the map that connects city A to city B by the given number of segments and colour
        Parameters:
        cityA - the name of the first city
        cityB - the name of the second city
        length - the number of segments that make up the route
        colour - the colour of the route to be added
        Returns:
        True if the route was correctly added to the map, false if not

      • addRoute

        public boolean addRoute(java.lang.String cityA,
                        java.lang.String cityB,
                        int length,
                        java.lang.String colour,
                        boolean flip)
        Add a route to the map that connects city A to city B by the given number of segments and colour and flip the arc of the route if the flip flag is enabled
        Parameters:
        cityA - the name of the first city
        cityB - the name of the second city
        length - the number of segments that make up the route
        colour - the colour of the route to be added
        flip - whether the route should be flipped or not
        Returns:
        True if the route was correctly added to the map, false if not

      • addRoute

        public boolean addRoute(java.lang.String cityA,
                        java.lang.String cityB,
                        int length,
                        java.lang.String colour,
                        boolean flip,
                        double offset)
        Add a route to the map that connects city A to city B by the given number of segments and colour, and flip the arc of the route if the flip flag is enabled, and move laterally by the specified offset
        Parameters:
        cityA - the name of the first city
        cityB - the name of the second city
        length - the number of segments that make up the route
        colour - the colour of the route to be added
        flip - whether the route should be flipped or not
        offset - the lateral offset of the route (used if there are two routes that connect the same cities or if routes overlap)
        Returns:
        True if the route was correctly added to the map, false if not

      • addRoute

        public boolean addRoute(java.lang.String cityA,
                        java.lang.String cityB,
                        int length,
                        java.lang.String colour,
                        double offset)
        Add a route to the map that connects city A to city B by the given number of segments and colour, and move laterally by the specified offset
        Parameters:
        cityA - the name of the first city
        cityB - the name of the second city
        length - the number of segments that make up the route
        colour - the colour of the route to be added
        offset - the lateral offset of the route (used if there are two routes that connect the same cities or if routes overlap)
        Returns:
        True if the route was correctly added to the map, false if not

      • claimRoute

        public void claimRoute(int route,
                       java.lang.String colour)
        Claim the route at the given index for the given player colour
        Parameters:
        route - the index of the route to claim
        colour - the unique colour of the player who's claiming the route
